questions.prompt: A 2:1 MUX has how many select lines?
questions.explanation: 2:1 MUX needs 1 select line to choose between 2 inputs. General rule: log2(N) select lines for N:1 MUX.

options: Y = S XOR X0 XOR X1
questions.explanation: Y = S'X0 + SX1. When S=0, X0 is selected; when S=1, X1 is selected.

questions.prompt: 4:1 MUX with S1S0=10 selects which input?
questions.explanation: S1S0 = 10 = binary 2, so X2 is selected. Select lines form the binary address of desired input.

questions.prompt: How many select lines for 8:1 MUX?
questions.explanation: 8:1 MUX needs 3 select lines since 2^3 = 8. General formula: log2(8) = 3.

questions.prompt: Any n-variable Boolean function can be implemented with:
questions.explanation: A 2^n:1 MUX can implement any n-variable function by connecting variables to select lines and truth table values to data inputs.
74LS151 is an 8:1 multiplexer IC with complementary outputs.

questions.prompt: To implement OR gate using 2:1 MUX:
questions.explanation: For Y=A+B: when A=0, Y=B; when A=1, Y=1. So X0=B, X1=1, S=A gives Y = S'*B + S*1 = A+B.

questions.prompt: How many 2:1 MUX needed to build 4:1 MUX?
questions.explanation: 4:1 needs 3 two-to-one MUX: 2 at first level, 1 at second level. Formula: 2^n - 1 for 2^n:1.

questions.prompt: MUX propagation delay in tree structure is:
questions.explanation: Tree-structured MUX has O(log N) delay because signals pass through log2(N) levels of 2:1 MUX.
AND: Y=1 only when AB=11. With S1=A, S0=B: connect X0=0 (00), X1=0 (01), X2=0 (10), X3=1 (11).

questions.prompt: Number of data inputs in 16:1 MUX is:
questions.explanation: 16:1 MUX has 16 data inputs (X0 to X15) and 4 select lines (since 2^4 = 16).
MUX is a data selector - it selects one of many inputs based on select lines and routes it to output.
